node.title: Electrostatic Shielding Model
node.bodyText:
Hi
I am trying to model electric field shielding for a 2d domain as follow:
Initially the electric field E along x axis is a continuous variable and identical along y-axis (due to symmetry).
However, a material property c(x,y,t) is used for executing shielding condition.
So whenever c(x0,y0,t0) > c_cutoff for x incrementing from x=0 to x = L (right boundary)
I want to execute E_new = E for x<=x0;
and,                      E_new = func(c(x0,y0,t0) ) for x>x0; irrespective of any other value of c along x.
Further I will be adding some smooth transitions for E.
Here E is a moose variable.
In simple words for moving from x= 0 to x = xmax if we encounter c(x=x0)>c_cuttoff I want to define a unit function U(x-x0) irrespective of any other value of c(x>x0).
I am unable to find a way to execute this in moose.
Please help.
Thanks

Hello
So E is the variable that you are solving the equations for right?
We call this the 'nonlinear' variable.
There is no way to set a nonlinear variable, you can only solve equations to compute them.
So instead I suggest you make the terms of your equations dependent on c.
for example:
somekernel::computeQpResidual()
{
  if (c[_qp] < c_cutoff)
    normal term for the equation
  else
    different term that gets the value you want for E
}

alternatively, you can use the Control system to change between sets of kernels based on a criterion.
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/syntax/Controls/index.html
Guillaume

Yes, but its not just c[_qp] >= c_cutoff for the else case, rather its like a trigger. So as soon as c[qp]> c_cutoff, the else condition should always be true along the x axis for particular y. Will this code work in that case.
Thanks

then you can keep a boolean called trigger in the kernel attributed
If the trigger happens, then set that boolean
and decide the term based on that boolean
The Controls system also handles triggers / persistent and non-persistent conditions

Couple of more thing

how to reset the boolean once x=xmax for qp?
What is the order if loop will begin qp with? I mean is it like first for y0 it will go for all x0 to x1 and so on upto xn. Then shift to y1 and so on to yn for a 2 D system.

is this a different condition for every qp?
if so a boolean on a per-kernel basis wont work btw. You ll need to create a field of booleans, either with an auxvariable and an auxkernel, or with material properties
you can have another if condition:
if (boolean and x > xmax)
  boolean = false

is this a different condition for every qp?

The condition is same but once it is executed for all {x0,x1,x2.....xn} at y0. It needs to be reset and check again for the same condition to be true for y1 and .... .
My query is as every element has two qp. So will it begin with element 1 of y and look for the condition for x elements (starting from x1 to xn) to be true. Then reset the boolean at x=xmax. And then move to element 2 of y and repeat for all x elements.

So there's a grid of elements? in X and Y?
We have layered user objects that can examine groups of elements in layers with an origin and an axis for layering

Yes I am using GeneratedMesh with nx and ny equal to 100.
Can't I just define a generic functor material that gives me a unit signal U(x-x0) if c(x0)>0. And then simply multiply it on my kernel.
Else, I will have to do it your way.
Thanks

if you want to examine more than 1 element to make a decision on the value, you need something that works with layers
If you can decide based on the local value of c on one element, then yes, please go ahead and write an auxkernel or material property for the cirterion

node.title: 3D axisymmetry to 2D
node.bodyText:
Hi @GiudGiud ,

When I wished to do this extruded 3D strutted in 2D, I used:
[Problem]
  type = FEProblem
  coord_type = XYZ
[]


Could you suggest, what should be it for an axisymmetry case, I don't want an extruded one like in the figure as both have similar projection. I want the one on the right. Does this work? Thanks.
[Problem]
  type = FEProblem
  coord_type = RZ
[]

you specify the symmetry axis (in the Mesh, in the Problem it is a deprecated parameter)
pick the axis that is horizontal in the mesh you show at the bottom

I did not get it, I used a mesh made in ABAQUS, which has coords for nodes and elements? How do I specify the axis?
In this case, it is :
in the [Mesh] block in the input there is a symmetry axis parameter to set

Hi @GiudGiud ,
I just used this as it is mentioned here:
If the RZ coordinate system is used, there are two options for how to specify the coordinate axis(es) in an input file:
Specify ["rz_coord_axis"](https://mooseframework.inl.gov/syntax/Mesh/#2ce1a211-2d33-4595-9032-b4227db24ba2) to choose a single RZ coordinate system, using the  direction and starting at  (0,0,0). If the former is used, then the axial coordinate is x, and the radial coordinate is y

https://mooseframework.inl.gov/syntax/Mesh/
  [./mesh]
    type = FileMeshGenerator
    file = Cyl.inp
    coord_type = RZ
    rz_coord_axis = X
  [../]


*** ERROR ***
/Users/sidharthsarmah/MOOSE/projects/moose/modules/tensor_mechanics/CZM/Cyl/cyl.i:17: unused parameter 'Mesh/mesh/coord_type'
/Users/sidharthsarmah/MOOSE/projects/moose/modules/tensor_mechanics/CZM/Cyl/cyl.i:18: unused parameter 'Mesh/mesh/rz_coord_axis'

[Mesh]
  coord_type = RZ
  rz_coord_axis = X
  [./mesh]
    type = FileMeshGenerator
    file = Cyl.inp
  [../]
[]
Thanks

Hi @GiudGiud , I have one confusion, when I apply a point load in 2D, it resembles a line load in 3D like this:

When I apply a line load in the RZ coord, it seems the load in something like this (right), but I want it to be like the other way(left), a load on top for bending:

[Mesh]
  coord_type = RZ
  rz_coord_axis = X
  [./mesh]
    type = FileMeshGenerator
    file = Cyl.inp
  [../]
  [./bounding_box]
    type = BoundingBoxNodeSetGenerator
    input = 'mesh'
    new_boundary = 'nodes_to_convert_to_sides'
    top_right = '25.3999996  5.71500015 0'
    bottom_left = '20 5 0'
  [../]
  [./create_sideset]
    type = SideSetsFromNodeSetsGenerator
    input = 'bounding_box'
  [../]
[]

[BCs]
  [./u_top_pull]
    type = ADPressure
    variable = disp_y
    boundary = load
    function = 0.1*t
  []
This is all expected, and there's no way around it. It's by definition of these coordinate systems.
Hi @GiudGiud , I agree on this but is there any way to just add a load at a particular theta along the radius? That would be interesting.
nope we unfortunatly do not have R-theta-z implemented, only RZ

I m not sure if it was part of your build routine

This is nonsensical
[ompratap.mme.nitt@login01 ~]$ mkdir $HOME/.moose_profile
[ompratap.mme.nitt@login01 ~]$ cd $HOME/.moose_profile

to do this first step, use vim and create a file called .moose_profile.
Not a folder
What is vim and how would one create the file called .moose_profile because I have similar issue

vim (and vi) is a text editor.
If you're working on a cluster it's very likely you will have one of those installed.
You do something like:
 vi .moose_profile to open a text file with that name, and when you save it creates the file.
What are you creating this profile file for? To load an environment?
vi takes a bit of getting used to, you should google it a little before trying.

I was running a script file that contained a line with that file and it could not be found and yes i am using a cluster. Below is the script file
#!/bin/bash                                                                     
#SBATCH --job-name kks_multiphase_largescale_large                                                 
#SBATCH --out  kks_multiphase_largescale_large.out        
#SBATCH --nodes 1                                                               
#SBATCH --ntasks 2
#SBATCH --cpus-per-task 8
#SBATCH --account amcorrosion                                                  
##SBATCH --partition normal_q                                                   
#SBATCH --time=100:00:00    
##SBATCH --mem=gpu:pascal:4                                                     
#SBATCH --export=NONE # this makes sure the compute environment is clean        
#SBATCH --mail-user emmanuel324@vt.edu
#SBATCH --mail-type=begin
#SBATCH --mail-type=end


source /home/emmanuel324/.moose_profile
module load apps site/tinkercliffs/easybuild/setup
module load apps site/tinkercliffs-rome/easybuild/setup
module load OpenMPI/4.1.1-GCC-10.3.0
module load CMake/3.20.1-GCCcore-10.3.0
module load Anaconda3/2020.11


cd "${submitdir}"
rm kks_multiphase_largescale_large_out.e*
#rm kks_multiphase_largescale_large_csv*
#rm kks_multiphase_largescale_large_out.e*
mpirun --mca orte_base_help_aggregate 0 -np 2 /home/emmanuel324/projects/belson/belson-opt  -i  kks_multiphase_largescale_large.i

oh so you just took this script from someone else.
They must have had some bash commands in this .moose_profile file
from your other post, when you submit the job, even module load fails. That needs to be addressed

I have resolved the module load by making some changes to the previous post and replacing it with module reset.
Ps: The person i took this script from said he also took it from someone else and does not know what it is. When we both run ls -la my .moose_profile seems to be empty whiles he has files in his. Can you show me a way he can send me those file and I store it in mine or create my own. My colleague and I are working in the same research group.

At INL, people would likely have something like this in their .moose_profile file. But it s not a requisite! I dont have a moose_profile file
This loads the pre-installed BISON app on the INL cluster, as well as all the right compilers and MPI
module load use.moose moose-apps bison

node.title: CZM examples
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I've noticed that the examples for the cohesive zone modeling do not work. I've tried to fix it up but it's still not working, I do not see where the interface boundary should be as in the other working files (ad_czm or bilinear_mixed_scale_strength) they are not mentioned either.
Thank you.
czm_multiple_dimension_base.txt

Hello
They work fine, it s just that you need to use the command line arguments in the tests file.
What the developers did here is that they created the skeleton for a simulation, and in the tests pass the missing pieces to make it work through the command line.
It's not ideal but it limits our maintenance burden.
When we have (in development)

input file includes
ability to delete existing parameters from the command line

We can make the test files work on their own and re-use them for several tests
Guillaume

node.title: Solving Te in a second order differential equation
node.bodyText:
I have been working on creating a plasma model and I am stuck solving Te(t). I was wondering if I could get some help implementing an equation below.


e, Ar, Ar+ are variables from the input file below and Tg = 500.

I would like to solve for Te(t) using the equation above, then plug Te(t) into rate coefficient equations in the reaction section. Is there a way to use the existing MOOSE kernels to solve this?
[Mesh]
  type = GeneratedMesh
  dim = 1
  xmin = 0
  xmax = 1
  nx = 1
[]

[Variables]
  [Ar+]
    family = SCALAR
    order = FIRST
    initial_condition = 1e6
  []
  [Ar2+]
    family = SCALAR
    order = FIRST
    initial_condition = 1e13
  []
  [Ar]
    family = SCALAR
    order = FIRST
    initial_condition = 9.05e+20
  []
[]

[ScalarKernels]
  [dAr+_dt]
    type = ODETimeDerivative
    variable = Ar+
  []
  [dAr2+_dt]
    type = ODETimeDerivative
    variable = Ar2+
  []
  [dAr_dt]
    type = ODETimeDerivative
    variable = Ar
  []
[]

[ChemicalReactions]
  [ScalarNetwork]
    species = 'Ar+ Ar2+ Ar'
    aux_species = 'e'
    interpolation_type = 'spline'
    # These are parameters required equation-based rate coefficients
    equation_constants = 'Tg'
    equation_values = '500'
    equation_variables = 'Te'
    reactions = 'e + Ar -> e + e + Ar+      :{2.34e-14*Te^(0.59)*exp(-17.44/Te)}
    e + e + Ar+ -> e + Ar      :{2e-39*Te^(-4.5)}
    e + Ar + Ar+ -> Ar + Ar    :{1.5e-40*(Tg/300)^(-2.5)}
    Ar+ -> Ar                  :{1/(1.95e7*Te + 8.41e5)}'
  []
[]

[AuxVariables]
  [e]
    order = FIRST
    family = SCALAR
  []
[]

[AuxScalarKernels]
  [Quasi_neutrality]
    type = VariableSum
    variable = e
    args = 'Ar+ Ar2+'
    execute_on = 'INITIAL TIMESTEP_END'
  []
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  automatic_scaling = true
  end_time = 0.001
  solve_type = 'newton'
  dtmin = 1.0e-20
  dtmax = 1e-06
  petsc_options_iname = '-snes_linesearch_type'
  petsc_options_value = 'basic'
[]

[Preconditioning]
  [smp]
    type = SMP
    full = true
  []
[]

[Outputs]
  csv = true
[]

Hello
This will take some coding work to get all the scalar kernels in that equation.
The first term is this scalar kernel:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/scalarkernels/ADScalarTimeDerivative.html
The second term will need to be coded, and you ll want to use this routine coupledScalarDotDot from the scalarCoupleable interface
The 3rd 4th and 5th term all have a functional form, which while simple has not been written down in an existing kernel.
So you ll need to make a few scalarkernels for these too.
But overall, this is very reasonable to do in MOOSE. If you followed the tutorial you know how to make regular kernels, you ll just want to adapt that knowledge to make scalar kernels instead (different base class, slightly different routine names)
Guillaume

node.title: Flux calculation
node.bodyText:
Hi All,
I would like to calculate the flux around a boundary and a block.
And hopefully, from the calculated flux, I would like to calculate the quantity by multiplying the time step size and the area. I would like to do these calculations to confirm that the quantity is conserved.
Please let me know if there are MOOSE apps do these for me.
S. Thomas

Hello
Which kind of flux? Diffusive? Advective?
Which method? Finite element CG/DG? Finite volume?
There's a bunch of postprocessors to compute various fluxes already in MOOSE yes. Picking the right one is not always easy though, you want to make sure the definition of the flux matches in the postprocessor and the kernels
Guillaume

Thank you, Guillaume.
I am going into Postprocessors and take a look at them.
I do appreciate your help, as always.
S. Thomas

You can try some of these:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/postprocessors/VolumetricFlowRate.html
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/postprocessors/BoundaryFluxPostprocessor.html
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/postprocessors/SideDiffusiveFluxIntegral.html
If you haven't seen it, we have a complete list for the available postprocessors in MOOSE. You are free to read their documentation and see if they are applicable to your problem.
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/

node.title: Permission denied in new app
node.bodyText:
Dear MOOSE experts,
I have developed a new app, compiled and built it successfully. The executable is generated after the "make -j 6" command. However, when I run the command "./run_tests -j 6", it shows "-bash: ./run_tests: Permission denied".
Would you be kind to let me know what is the problem?
I am not getting it.
Thanks for your support.

Hello
Something went wrong when you downloaded your code maybe. Did you sudo git clone ? that would cause that
the solution now is to change the permissions using the chmod command. Do at least that one, but maybe you ll need more
chmod +x run_tests

Guillaume

Yes, first I cloned from my colleague's repository using Git desktop. then modified and built.
But, if I download the files as a Zip folder and work on it, this problem will be solved?
git clone is the natural way to do this. Should work better than using zip files

Dear Dr. Guillaume,
Having another problem:
/usr/bin/env: ‘python\r’: No such file or directory
while giving the command "./run_tests -j 6"
Is it indicating something? any solution for this problem?
Thanks.

I thought we adjusted all our shebangs with python3 instead of simply python. What file is this? Can you post the location of where it resides in the moose repo?
pwd

Dear Dr. Jason Miller,
The problem is related to building an app from a repository using Git desktop.
I have successfull built the app after required modification. However when ./run_tests -j 6 command given, the error
"/usr/bin/env: ‘python\r’: No such file or directory" 

pops up. Please be aware that the app is more than three years old. The only python file I am seeing in my application folder (/home/user/projects/test3/melt/doc):
#* Licensed under LGPL 2.1, please see LICENSE for details
#* https://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl-2.1.html

import sys
import os

# Locate MOOSE directory
MOOSE_DIR = os.getenv('MOOSE_DIR', os.path.abspath(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__name__), '..', 'moose')))
if not os.path.exists(MOOSE_DIR):
    MOOSE_DIR = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__name__), '..', '..', 'moose'))
if not os.path.exists(MOOSE_DIR):
    raise Exception('Failed to locate MOOSE, specify the MOOSE_DIR environment variable.')
os.environ['MOOSE_DIR'] = MOOSE_DIR

# Append MOOSE python directory
MOOSE_PYTHON_DIR = os.path.join(MOOSE_DIR, 'python')
if MOOSE_PYTHON_DIR not in sys.path:
    sys.path.append(MOOSE_PYTHON_DIR)

from MooseDocs import main
if __name__ == '__main__':
    sys.exit(main.run()) """

So what modification I should do and in which file to solve this python problem, would you be kind to let me know!
I would appreciate your advice.
Thanks and best regards.
I am not sure that will work. But worth a shot. I see no SHEBANG set at all... so I am not even sure where it though to try and run /usr/bin/env python.
we have #!/usr/bin/env python3 at the top of run_tests too
I am talking about what was posted as @mdh23rct's version of run_tests. I just don't see any SHEBANG there. So I am unsure what file we need to alter. Unless it was just a bad copy/paste?

Dear Dr. Guillaume and Dr. Miller,
I have added the SHEBANG in moosedocs.py and run_tests. However, no luck.
Then, I checked the data format of the files, since I am using wsl in windows.
I have converted the run_tests from dos2unix format. This time ./run_tests -j 6 worked, but test of all objects failed.
Maybe I have some data compatibility issues! You have any comment on that!
Best regards.

node.title: Build failing on Mac (ld: library not found)
node.bodyText:
Hi, I'm trying to install MOOSE locally on my laptop. I've followed the installation instructions, and the build issues section on the troubleshooting page, but the problem persists.
A whole load of Compiling C++ is done successfully, until the following warnings and errors appear and the build fails.
...
Compiling C++ (in opt mode) /Users/me/moose/modules/heat_conduction/build/unity_src/actions_Unity.C...
Compiling C++ (in opt mode) /Users/me/moose/modules/heat_conduction/build/unity_src/fvbcs_Unity.C...
Compiling C++ (in opt mode) /Users/me/moose/modules/heat_conduction/src/base/HeatConductionApp.C...
ld: warning: -pie being ignored. It is only used when linking a main executable
ld: warning: -pie being ignored. It is only used when linking a main executable
ld: warning: -pie being ignored. It is only used when linking a main executable
ld: warning: -pie being ignored. It is only used when linking a main executable
ld: warning: -pie being ignored. It is only used when linking a main executable
Compiling Fortan Plugin (in opt mode) /Users/me/moose/modules/tensor_mechanics/test/plugins/elastic_incremental.f...
x86_64-apple-darwin13.4.0-gfortran: warning: could not understand version 12.0
Compiling Fortan Plugin (in opt mode) /Users/me/moose/modules/tensor_mechanics/test/plugins/elastic_print_multiple_fields.f...
ld: library not found for -lgcc_s.10.4
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
make: *** [/Users/me/moose/framework/build.mk:325: /Users/me/moose/modules/tensor_mechanics/test/plugins/elastic_incremental-opt.plugin] Error 1
make: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
x86_64-apple-darwin13.4.0-gfortran: warning: could not understand version 12.0
ld: library not found for -lgcc_s.10.4
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
make: *** [/Users/me/moose/framework/build.mk:325: /Users/me/moose/modules/tensor_mechanics/test/plugins/elastic_print_multiple_fields-opt.plugin] Error 1
ld: warning: -pie being ignored. It is only used when linking a main executable
ld: warning: -pie being ignored. It is only used when linking a main executable
ld: warning: -pie being ignored. It is only used when linking a main executable

I've got an Intel processor Macbook Pro with Ventura 13.5.

Hello
Could you please run the diagnostics script in moose/scripts?
Something s going wrong with the compilers. Usually it's Xcode s fault but let s check
Guillaume

@milljm have you seen this error before?
@dschwen any idea what could be bringing in gcc_s for fortran plugins?

AR=x86_64-apple-darwin13.4.0-ar
AS=x86_64-apple-darwin13.4.0-as
BUILD=x86_64-apple-darwin13.4.0

This suggests "Big Sur". So I think @GiudGiud's assumption of Xcode is correct. When you upgraded your MacOS version to Ventura, Mac fails to also upgrade Xcode in the process. They leave that to you (and don't tell you!). Please attempt to upgrade your Xcode (or Xcode Command Line Tools). I believe the following command may get that started:
xcode-select --install
If you run into the following:
❯ xcode-select --install
xcode-select: error: command line tools are already installed, use "Software Update" in System Settings to install updates
You'll have to use the App Store to download Xcode, in full, and proceed from there. If you do end up going this route, when the download/install is complete, be sure to launch Xcode to actually finish the installation. Heh. Xcode is so picky.

Thanks for the help. After xcode-select install I did indeed get that error, so downloaded XCode 15.0. When I opened it, it did appear to do some additional setup. However I tried make clobberall and make -j8 and am still getting the same error.
There doesn't seem to be any meaningful change to the ./diagnostics output either, especially the AR, AS, and BUILD variables.
If it helps, running gfortran --version within the moose mamba environment gives the warning gfortran: warning: could not understand version 12.0, whereas running the same in a fresh terminal didn't cause a problem.

It s probably a different gfortran in the fresh terminal and the moose environment, and that's ok.
EDIT: see below
I would first try to update mamba. Then if it doesnt work i d switch to the install from source way to avoid losing more time

You should not have gfortran available... Using Conda, and our packages, gfortran is actually supplied as arm64-apple-darwin20.0.0-gfortran
You can verify this by running:
mpif90 -show
So the fact that you do have a gfortran binary of some kind, can you perform a which on it?
which gfortran
I am thinking that you might have a Homebrew install (possibly) getting in the way of your Conda environment...

This is also interesting to me:
SDKROOT=/Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/SDKs/MacOSX.sdk

I didn't notice it before... I am not sure what sets this. But its not Conda (not that I know of). I have seen another post where this was set, and we (well I) thought it might point at part of the issue.

I did a completely fresh install of mamba today, tried mamba update --all just in case and got All requested packages already installed. Will attempt to install from source as suggested later in the week if this can't be solved.
Interestingly, mpif90 -show didn't actually show arm64-apple-darwin20.0.0-gfortran - I got:
x86_64-apple-darwin13.4.0-gfortran -I/Users/me/mambaforge3/envs/moose/include -L/Users/me/mambaforge3/envs/moose/lib -Wl,-rpath,/Users/me/mambaforge3/envs/moose/lib -Wl,-commons,use_dylibs -I/Users/me/mambaforge3/envs/moose/include -I/Users/me/mambaforge3/envs/moose/include -L/Users/me/mambaforge3/envs/moose/lib -lmpifort -lmpi -lpmpi

And which gfortran gives me:
/Users/me/mambaforge3/envs/moose/bin/gfortran

Huh, maybe this is some sort of difference between Arm and Intel Macs?
I don't mean this part:
arm64-apple-darwin20.0.0-gfortran and x86_64-apple-darwin13.4.0-gfortran. That most certainly will be the difference between Arm and Intel.
But the part about Intel having an actual gfortran listing... I don't have that on my machine. @GiudGiud  do you?
Intel machine is at home rn. I can check late tonight

Using one of our test machines: indeed. It's an Intel thing.
(testing) $ which gfortran
/Users/civet0/projects/mamba3/envs/testing/bin/gfortran

(testing) $ gfortran --version
GNU Fortran (GCC) 9.5.0
Copyright (C) 2019 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
I also see an SDKROOT being set. So that must be normal.
